required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention of Cardiac Allograft Vasculopathy Using Rituximab (Rituxan) Therapy in Cardiac Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Prevention of Cardiac Allograft Vasculopathy Using Rituximab (Rituxan) Therapy in Cardiac Transplantation (CTOT-11)

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock: All people who have a heart transplant are at risk for developing cardiac allograft vasculopathy (CAV). CAV means narrowing of the heart transplant vessels, which is associated with poor heart transplant function. People who develop antibodies after transplant have a higher risk of developing CAV. Infections, high cholesterol, and rejection also increase the risk of developing CAV. People who develop CAV usually have to receive another transplant.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to see if a study drug called rituximab (Rituxan®) prevents CAV. Rituximab destroys certain types of white blood cells called B cells. B cells are important cells in the immune system that help the body fight infection by producing substances called antibodies. B cells and the antibodies they produce are also involved in some kinds of rejection after organ transplantation. Rituximab decreases the number of B cells in the blood and other tissues. The goal of this study is to determine if decreasing B cells with Rituximab can prevent injury to the transplanted heart.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Due to inability to meet accrual goals within the funding period

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Nominal or noticeable change, bad or good, from baseline to 1 year in percent atheroma volume (PAV) which is a measure of the degree of coronary arterial obstruction due to host alloimmune processes measured by intravascular ultrasound (IVUS) in a target coronary artery. Thus a decrease in PAV would be an indicator of less obstruction and a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.description: Participants who died within 12 months post-transplant
Re-transplantation is defined as the receipt of a subsequent heart transplant and re-listed for transplantation is being listed back on the heart transplant list to be re-transplanted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Episodes of Biopsy Proven Acute Rejection (BPAR) of Any Grade Per Participant
secondary_outcome.description: The number of times a participant experienced biopsy proven acute rejection (BPAR). Biopsy proven acute rejection is when an examination of tissue removed from the transplanted organ indicates that the subject's immune system is trying to reject the graft. BPAR was defined as a biopsy that met the International Society for Heart & Lung Transplantation (ISHLT) criteria to be graded as 1R or greater rejection and was determined by a single, central pathology laboratory.

The number of subjects who experienced any grade of biopsy proven acute rejection (BPAR) within the clinical trial. Biopsy proven acute rejection is when an examination of tissue removed from the transplanted organ indicates that the subject's immune system is trying to reject the graft. BPAR was defined as a biopsy which met The International Society for Heart & Lung Transplantation (ISHLT) criteria to be graded as 1R or greater rejection and was determined by a single, central pathology laboratory.

The number of participants who experienced antibody- mediated rejection (AMR). Antibody-mediated rejection (AMR) occurs when the subject develops antibodies directed against the transplanted heart. This was assessed based on local pathology biopsy reads.

Cellular Rejection refers to the organ recipient's immune system recognizing a transplanted organ as foreign and mounting a response to it via cellular mechanisms. Cellular rejection was defined as a biopsy which met The International Society for Heart & Lung Transplantation (ISHLT) criteria to be graded as 1R or greater rejection and was determined by a single, central pathology laboratory

The number of participants who were treated by their local physician for any type of rejection including, but not limited to cellular rejection and antibody- mediated rejection (AMR) of the transplanted heart regardless of the presence of a biopsy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Episodes of Rejection Associated With Hemodynamic Compromise (HDC)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants that experienced at least one episode of rejection associated with hemodynamic compromise (HDC). Rejection associated with HDC is when there is insufficient blood flow to the transplanted heart in association with acute rejection found in a biopsy. Local biopsies were used for this outcome measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Development of Angiographically Evident Cardiac Allograft Vasculopathy
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiac allograft vasculopathy is an aggressive form of atherosclerosis that is characterized by the development of fibrosis affecting cardiac arteries that result in concentric narrowing of the arteries and, ultimately allograft failure. Development of cardiac allograft vasculopathy can be diagnosed via an angiograph which is an X-ray of the cardiac arteries by injecting a radiopaque substance such as iodine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Post-transplant Serious Infections Requiring Intravenous Antimicrobial Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Transplantation through end of study, up to 1 year post transplantation.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants experiencing at least one serious infection requiring intravenous antimicrobial therapy which is used to kill the growth of microorganisms such as bacteria, fungi, or protozoans.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Post-transplant Incidence of PTLD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Transplantation through end of study, up to 1 year post transplantation.
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants experiencing at least one post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder (PTLD) occurrence during this trial. Post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder is an uncontrolled proliferation of B cell lymphocytes latently infected with Epstein-Barr virus.

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-transplant Safety Outcomes Among Participants: Safety and Tolerability of Rituximab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Transplantation through end of study, up to 1 year post transplantation
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as participants that experienced at least one adverse event that was possibly, probably, or definitely related to the study drug (i.e., Rituximab or Placebo). Serious adverse events were used to evaluate this endpoint and the attribution was based on the DAIT Medical Monitor's assessment.

intervention.intervention_name: Rituximab induction/conventional immunosuppression (tacrolimus, MMF, and steroid taper)
Rituximab placebo/conventional immunosuppression (tacrolimus, MMF, and steroid taper)

link.description: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) website
Clinical Trials in Organ Transplantation (CTOT) website
National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI) website

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Twenty three out of N=24 participating sites in the United States enrolled 362 participants into this trial. N=163 participants reached the randomization stage of the trial.

group.title: Rituximab
group.description: Induction: Rituximab was administered in 2 1000 mg doses on Day 0 and Day 12 (+/- 2 days). Maintenance: Mycophenolate Mofetil (MMF) was given at a starting dose of 2-3 g by mouth or intravenously per day in 2 or 3 divided doses. Investigator could choose an alternative treatment if needed. Methylprednisolone/Prednisone dosing was administered according to the local center standard. After 6 months, prednisone was withdrawn at the discretion of the investigator. The suggested oral prednisone taper was Day 14: 20 mg/day by mouth, Day 30: 15 mg/day by mouth, Day 90: 10 mg/day by mouth, Day 180: 5 mg/day by mouth, and greater than Day 180: 0-5 mg/day by mouth. Tacrolimus, was administered per site standards to attain target trough levels. The target whole blood tacrolimus concentrations were as follows: Day 1-30 post transplant 10-20 ng/mL and Day 31-Month 12 5-15 ng/mL.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Induction: Rituximab Placebo was administered in 2 1000 mg doses on Day 0 and Day 12 (+/- 2 days). Maintenance: Mycophenolate Mofetil (MMF) was given at a starting dose of 2-3 g by mouth or intravenously per day in 2 or 3 divided doses. Investigator could choose an alternative treatment if needed. Methylprednisolone/Prednisone dosing was administered according to the local center standard. After 6 months, prednisone was withdrawn at the discretion of the investigator. The suggested oral prednisone taper was Day 14: 20 mg/day by mouth, Day 30: 15 mg/day by mouth, Day 90: 10 mg/day by mouth, Day 180: 5 mg/day by mouth, and greater than Day 180: 0-5 mg/day by mouth. Tacrolimus, was administered per site standards to attain target trough levels. The target whole blood tacrolimus concentrations were as follows: Day 1-30 post transplant 10-20 ng/mL and Day 31-Month 12 5-15 ng/mL.

group.title: Discontinued Pre-Transplant
group.description: Subjects that enrolled, but withdrew from the study prior to their transplant.

group.title: Discontinued Pre-Randomization
group.description: Subjects that were enrolled and transplanted on study, but withdrew from the study prior to randomization.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Moves,enrollment in mx studies, et al.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Change in Percent Atheroma Volume (PAV)
outcome.description: Nominal or noticeable change, bad or good, from baseline to 1 year in percent atheroma volume (PAV) which is a measure of the degree of coronary arterial obstruction due to host alloimmune processes measured by intravascular ultrasound (IVUS) in a target coronary artery. Thus a decrease in PAV would be an indicator of less obstruction and a better outcome.

Maintenance: Mycophenolate Mofetil (MMF) was given at a starting dose of 2-3 g by mouth or intravenously per day in 2 or 3 divided doses. Investigator could choose an alternative treatment if needed. Methylprednisolone/Prednisone dosing was administered according to the local center standard. After 6 months, prednisone was withdrawn at the discretion of the investigator. The suggested oral prednisone taper was Day 14: 20 mg/day by mouth, Day 30: 15 mg/day by mouth, Day 90: 10 mg/day by mouth, Day 180: 5 mg/day by mouth, and greater than Day 180: 0-5 mg/day by mouth. Tacrolimus, was administered per site standards to attain target trough levels. The target whole blood tacrolimus concentrations were as follows: Day 1-30 post transplant 10-20 ng/mL and Day 31-Month 12 5-15 ng/mL.

measure.title: Incidence of Any Treated Rejection
measure.description: The number of participants who were treated by their local physician for any type of rejection including, but not limited to cellular rejection and antibody- mediated rejection (AMR) of the transplanted heart regardless of the presence of a biopsy.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Episodes of Rejection Associated With Hemodynamic Compromise (HDC)
outcome.description: The number of participants that experienced at least one episode of rejection associated with hemodynamic compromise (HDC). Rejection associated with HDC is when there is insufficient blood flow to the transplanted heart in association with acute rejection found in a biopsy. Local biopsies were used for this outcome measure.

group.title: Rituximab
group.description: Induction: Rituximab was administered in 2 1000 mg doses on Day 0 and Day 12 (+/- 2 days). Maintenance: Mycophenolate Mofetil (MMF) was given at a starting dose of 2-3 g by mouth or intravenously per day in 2 or 3 divided doses. Investigator could choose an alternative treatment if needed. Methylprednisolone/Prednisone dosing was administered according to the local center standard. After 6 months, prednisone was withdrawn at the discretion of the investigator. The suggested oral prednisone taper was Day 14: 20 mg/day by mouth, Day 30: 15 mg/day by mouth, Day 90: 10 mg/day by mouth, Day 180: 5 mg/day by mouth, and greater than Day 180: 0-5 mg/day by mouth. The target whole blood tacrolimus concentrations were as follows: Day 1-30 post transplant 10-20 ng/mL and Day 31-Month 12 5-15 ng/mL.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Episodes of Rejection Associated With Hemodynamic Compromise (HDC)
measure.description: The number of participants that experienced at least one episode of rejection associated with hemodynamic compromise (HDC). Rejection associated with HDC is when there is insufficient blood flow to the transplanted heart in association with acute rejection found in a biopsy. Local biopsies were used for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Development of Angiographically Evident Cardiac Allograft Vasculopathy
outcome.description: Cardiac allograft vasculopathy is an aggressive form of atherosclerosis that is characterized by the development of fibrosis affecting cardiac arteries that result in concentric narrowing of the arteries and, ultimately allograft failure. Development of cardiac allograft vasculopathy can be diagnosed via an angiograph which is an X-ray of the cardiac arteries by injecting a radiopaque substance such as iodine.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Post-transplant Serious Infections Requiring Intravenous Antimicrobial Therapy
outcome.description: Number of participants experiencing at least one serious infection requiring intravenous antimicrobial therapy which is used to kill the growth of microorganisms such as bacteria, fungi, or protozoans.
outcome.time_frame: Transplantation through end of study, up to 1 year post transplantation.

measure.description: Number of participants experiencing at least one serious infection requiring intravenous antimicrobial therapy which is used to kill the growth of microorganisms such as bacteria, fungi, or protozoans.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Post-transplant Incidence of PTLD
outcome.description: The number of participants experiencing at least one post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder (PTLD) occurrence during this trial. Post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder is an uncontrolled proliferation of B cell lymphocytes latently infected with Epstein-Barr virus.
outcome.time_frame: Transplantation through end of study, up to 1 year post transplantation.

group.title: Rituximab
group.description: Induction: Rituximab was administered in 2 1000 mg doses on Day 0 and Day 12 (+/- 2 days). Tacrolimus, was administered per site standards to attain target trough levels. measure.title: Number of Participants With Post-transplant Incidence of PTLD
measure.description: The number of participants experiencing at least one post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder (PTLD) occurrence during this trial. Post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder is an uncontrolled proliferation of B cell lymphocytes latently infected with Epstein-Barr virus.

outcome.title: Post-transplant Safety Outcomes Among Participants: Safety and Tolerability of Rituximab
outcome.description: Defined as participants that experienced at least one adverse event that was possibly, probably, or definitely related to the study drug (i.e., Rituximab or Placebo). Serious adverse events were used to evaluate this endpoint and the attribution was based on the DAIT Medical Monitor's assessment.
outcome.time_frame: Transplantation through end of study, up to 1 year post transplantation

group.title: Rituximab
group.description: Induction: Rituximab was administered in 2 1000 mg doses on Day 0 and Day 12 (+/- 2 days). Maintenance: Mycophenolate Mofetil (MMF) was given at a starting dose of 2-3 g by mouth or intravenously per day in 2 or 3 divided doses. Investigator could choose an alternative treatment if needed. Methylprednisolone/Prednisone dosing was administered according to the local center standard. After 6 months, prednisone was withdrawn at the discretion of the investigator. The suggested oral prednisone taper was Day 14: 20 mg/day by mouth, Day 30: 15 mg/day by mouth, Day 90: 10 mg/day by mouth, Day 180: 5 mg/day by mouth, and greater than Day 180: 0-5 mg/day by mouth. Tacrolimus, was administered per site standards to attain target trough levels. The target whole blood tacrolimus concentrations were as follows: Day 1-30 post transplant 10-20 ng/mL and Day 31-Month 12 5-15 ng/mL.

reported_events.time_frame: From enrollment through end of study (up to one year post randomization)

group.title: Discontinued Pre-Transplant
group.description: Subjects that enrolled, but withdrew from the study prior to their transplant.

group.title: Discontinued Pre-Randomization
group.description: Subjects that were enrolled and transplanted on study, but withdrew from the study prior to randomization.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study was terminated with 163 participants randomized, well short of the study's goal of 300 randomized participants.
